page.title: 18The Ecology of the Canal 2
page.content: The central zone of the canal habitat can be described as a{linear } {conservation}area.It is a{living zoo} without cages,animals are free to go where they want. The canal zone sometimes grows when the{canal floods}.This causes three large ponds to form which provide a wet{habitat}for amphibians and insects. Oil is the chief{pollutant}that these animals have to fight against.{People} who go 'newting' disturb the mud which mingles with the oil .The animals avoid the black sludge at all costs. The effects of increasing housing development,industrial pollutants and the attentions of people, are the most important factors in the survival of the canal zone's wildlife.Learning about wildlife should help to make people more aware of animal needs.
